title: What DVOA says about the Bengals, Giants, Patriots, Bears and more: Keep an eye on these six things
content: Just how bad is the Cincinnati defense? How does the Giants' run D stack up since 1978? And are the Patriots and Bears legit? Let's use DVOA to find out.

title: Sources: Kelly officially fired by LSU without cause
content: The posturing over Brian Kelly's $54 million buyout from LSU is over, sources told ESPN, as the school sent him a letter Wednesday saying it is officially terminating him without cause.

title: Sources: Jays, Cease reach 7-year, $210M deal
content: Right-hander Dylan Cease, who has made at least 32 starts in each of the past five seasons, reached a seven-year, $210 million deal with the Blue Jays, sources told ESPN.

title: Michigan makes statement in beating Zags by 40
content: Yaxel Lendeborg said the Wolverines made a statement about their place in college basketball's hierarchy with a 40-point victory over Gonzaga in the Players Era title game Wednesday night.

title: Curry limps off with bruised quad, will have MRI
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry came up limping with a right quad contusion after a series of fourth-quarter collisions in Wednesday's loss to the Rockets and will undergo an MRI.

title: Center Ragnow ends retirement to return to Lions
content: Frank Ragnow, a four-time Pro Bowler for the Lions, is ending his five-month retirement and returning to play for Detroit.

title: Faulk expected to land Southern job, sources say
content: Former NFL star and current Colorado RBs coach Marshall Faulk is expected to become head coach at Southern University, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Celts halt Pistons' win streak at 13 in frantic finish
content: Cade Cunningham scored 42 points but missed a potential game-tying free throw in the closing seconds as the Pistons fell to the Celtics 117-114, ending their 13-game winning streak.

title: QB Smith apologizes for obscene gesture to fans
content: Geno Smith apologized for making an obscene gesture toward fans as he walked off the field following a 24-10 loss to the Browns on Sunday. It's the second time he has made such a gesture toward fans since joining Las Vegas.

title: Will Lane Kiffin go to Florida? Or LSU? Or will he stay at Ole Miss? Here's the case for each team
content: The coach will announce his decision later in the week. Here's what he might be weighing in the meantime.

title: Inside the Chiefs' obsession with the Dallas Cowboys
content: Originally the Dallas Texans, the Chiefs were forced to leave Big D in 1963. They've had their eye on surpassing the Cowboys ever since.

title: How a Dak Prescott initiative saved a Cowboys exec with Stage 2 cancer
content: Dallas QB and the senior VP of communications look back on their friendship through a fortified bond.

title: Latest chapter of Jackson vs. Burrow has been defined by injuries and divergent results
content: Jackson and Burrow face questions about whether they can reach those same prime-time heights of seasons past.

title: Men: What Michigan, Kansas wins mean; previewing Thursday games
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a showcase in New York City, here's what we're watching Thanksgiving week.

title: 37 games with postseason implications to fill your Rivalry Week menu
content: As if the intensity of rival games weren't enough, there are high stakes everywhere you look this weekend.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Everything to know before Friday's final night of group play
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Mark Andrews, downgrade Javonte Williams
content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: WWE Survivor Series: Key stats and info to know before WarGames
content: As we approach Saturday's WWE premium live event, let's catch up on some notes and stats for each match.

title: Preview: Can the teams coexist?
content: Breaking down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: MLB offseason survey: 16 execs predict free agency, blockbuster trades and more
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: How Tyrese Maxey went from the hardwood to the 2025 National Dog Show
content: The Philadelphia 76ers star ran two dogs through the Purina Pro Plan Incredible Dog Challenge Agility Show while the show taped in Philadelphia.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 3.0: Reyna, Scally back in the fold
content: We're closing in on the new year, and with months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make next year's squad?

title: Chaos for Barcelona and Liverpool, Arsenal No. 1: Reranking the Champions League
content: With just three games left, Arsenal look like the best team in the competition, while Barcelona, Liverpool and Man City are spiraling. Let's review how the UEFA Champions League looks after Matchday 5.

title: Talking points: Pep's tinkering costs City, Arsenal look unstoppable
content: Statement wins, coaches under pressure and bizarre team selections. ESPN writers break down Matchday 5.

title: Over the river and through the parlays: Thanksgiving is a sports betting holiday too
content: With big games and marquee teams on the menu, Thanksgiving week is among busiest of the year for sportsbooks.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Fernandes among 11 Man United players facing exit
content: Bruno Fernandes is one of 11 players Manchester United are willing to let go in a major squad overhaul. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UP Mass Wedding Turns Chaotic As Crowd Rushes To Grab, Snatch Chips
content: Chaos erupted at a mass wedding ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district on Tuesday when guests rushed to grab snacks being served at the venue. Several of the guests suffered injuries during the chaos.

title: Jal Jeevan Mission Finds 26% Villages Without Water, 7 States Face Big Fine
content: Ground checks by 287 central officers revealed that only 68% of villages under mega water-supply schemes had regular water supply, 6% had irregular supply, and 26% were completely non-functional.

title: CIA, Mossad Engineered Congress Defeat In 2014, Says Party's Former MP
content: Congress's former MP Kumar Ketkar has claimed that the US intelligence agency CIA and their Israeli counterpart Mossad had plotted the defeat of the Congress in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls.

title: Expelled AIADMK Leader KA Sengottaiyan Gets Key Post In Vijay's TVK
content: Expelled AIADMK veteran KA Sengottaiyan has been appointed Chief Coordinator of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's (TVK) new 28-member High-Level Administrative Committee, a day after formally joining the party.

title: "Enlargement Of Territorial Claims Untenable": Government Sources On Nepal Currency Row
content: Nepal unveiled a new 100-rupee note on Thursday that features a revised national map including disputed areas such as the Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura territories. These are regions that India maintains are its own.

title: "Mandate Not For A Moment, But For 5 Years": Siddaramaiah's "Word" Dig Amid Leadership Tussle
content: "Mandate not for a moment, but for full 5 years": Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's "word" dig amid leadership tussle

title: Alleged Nazi Camp Guard, 100, May Face Trial For Carrying Executions
content: The man, according to prosecutors, was involved in killings while working at Stalag VI A, a prisoner-of-war camp in Hemer, Germany, between December 1943 and September 1944.

title: Why Hong Kong's Deadly Fire Spread Swiftly - Focus On Fast-Burning Foam
content: Three top officials of the engineering company renovating the tower complex have been arrested in a suspected case of manslaughter.

title: 'Courts Aren't Arenas For Political Battles': Ex-Chief Justice BR Gavai
content: Former Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Thursday reflected on his tenure at the country's highest judicial office, asserting satisfaction with his work while addressing contemporary challenges.

title: Delhi Man Kills Live-In Partner, Puts Her Body In Car, Goes Home To Sleep
content: A 44-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her inebriated live-in partner, who throttled her with his elbow during an altercation over money at their Chhawla residence in southwest Delhi, police said on Thursday.

title: The Hong Kong Deadly High-Rise Fire: All You Need To Know
content: A devastating fire tore through a Hong Kong high-rise residential complex, killing dozens of people with hundreds still missing.

title: Trump Calls Woman Journalist "Ugly" Days After He Called Another "Piggy"
content: Days after using the derogatory term "piggy" for a journalist, US President Donald Trump has now called a New York Times reporter "ugly."

title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Ousted PM Sheikh Hasina To 21 Years In 3 Corruption Cases
content: A Bangladesh court on Thursday sentenced deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina to 21 years in jail in three corruption cases related to irregularities in allocations of land in a government housing project.

title: Chinese Woman Looking For A 'Daughter' Online, Offers Flat, Rs 38,000 Salary
content: An elderly Chinese woman is looking for a "daughter" online to care for her. Ma, the woman from Henan province, has promised a flat and a monthly salary for anyone who comes forward to look after her.

title: Nepal Issues Rs 100 Currency Notes With New Map. It Has 3 Indian Territories
content: Nepal's central bank on Thursday issued new Rs 100 currency notes featuring a revised map that includes the Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura territories, the regions India maintains belong to it.

title: Paralysed Man Shifted From Government To Private Hospital Over "Commission"
content: A case was registered against a private hospital and an ambulance driver for allegedly taking a paralysed patient out of a state-run medical college and moving him to a private facility in return for a commission, officials said on Thursday.

title: New Zealand Declares War, Will Eradicate 25 Lakh "Stone Cold Killers"
content: New Zealand is planning to eradicate feral cats across the country by 2050 with the aim of protecting its fragile native wildlife. Conservation Minister Tama Potaka described feral cats as "stone cold killers."

title: Assam Passes Bill To Ban Polygamy, Makes It Criminal Offence
content: The Assam Legislative Assembly on Thursday passed a bill to ban polygamy, making it a punishable offence with up to seven years of imprisonment, along with a provision for compensation to the victim woman, Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Is Imran Khan Dead? What Pakistani Jail Authorities Said
content: Imran Khan is stable and still inside Adiala Jail, Pakistan government officials said on Wednesday, dismissing rumours of his death in custody or that he had been secretly moved out of the Rawalpindi facility.

title: University In Kerala Repeats Last Year's Question Paper: Official
content: A question paper for the Undergraduate Multi Disciplinary Course (MDC) examination held recently at Calicut University here was found to be a repeat of one used in a previous year's exam, officials said on Thursday.

title: 'Word' war: K'taka CM tussle turns ugly; Sidda takes open potshot at DKS
content: Karnataka's top Congress leaders, chief minister Siddaramaiah and deputy CM DK Shivakumar, engaged in a public spat on social media. Shivakumar alluded to a "secret deal" for a rotational chief ministership, while Siddaramaiah countered by emphasizing his commitment to a full five-year term and highlighting fulfilled promises. This open conflict signals a significant escalation beyond their supporters' verbal exchanges.

title: 'JD to dump Usha for Erika': How Joy Reid normalised Hinduphobia, misogyny
content: Reid, wearing a t-shirt that says F*** Trump, F*** ICE, Free Palestine, Unoccupy Chicago, and a bunch of other messages which combined explain the dire strait in which the Democratic Party finds itself, casually claims that JD Vance will drop his “brown Hindu wife” Usha for “white queen” Erika Kirk.

title: Fighting crime: UAE halts visas to Pakistanis; stops short of banning passport
content: UAE has significantly curtailed visa issuance for Pakistanis, narrowly avoiding a complete passport ban. This move, reportedly due to concerns over criminal activities by visitors, has caused considerable difficulty for Pakistani nationals seeking entry. Meanwhile, UAE officials highlight visa facilitation reforms, processing hundreds of visas daily at a new center.

title: Hong Kong fire tragedy: Toll rises to 65, 100s missing; flames still visible on Day 2
content: A devastating fire at a Hong Kong housing complex has claimed 65 lives, with hundreds still missing. The blaze, believed to have started in scaffolding, engulfed seven of eight towers. Three men have been arrested for manslaughter amid a corruption probe into the renovation project, as authorities investigate fire-resistance standards and consider phasing out bamboo scaffolding.

title: 'Keep the pace': Alibaba CEO slams AI bubble fear— plans to invest 'aggressively'
content: Alibaba's CEO Eddie Wu dismisses AI bubble fears, planning aggressive investment despite Google's Sundar Pichai warning of "irrationality" and potential dotcom-like crash. Wu cites surging customer demand for AI resources, predicting shortages for three years, with Alibaba's Qwen app already exceeding 10 million downloads.  While Alibaba's profits dipped due to AI spending, its cloud division saw significant growth, prompting Wu to suggest their AI investment might be underestimated, contrasting with some internal skepticism.

title: Nifty50, Sensex hit lifetime highs: What's driving rally & is it sustainable? Explained
content: Stock market at record high! Nifty50 has crossed 26,300 and Sensex has gone past 86,000 for the first time. There is renewed optimism about the Indian stock markets - but is the current rally sustainable? Here's what experts have to say:

title: WB school jobs scam: SSC updates list of ‘tainted’ teachers; school names remain a mystery
content: The West Bengal School Service Commission has republished a “comprehensive” list of 1,806 tainted candidates today from the 2016 SLST, after the Calcutta High Court’s order. But while names, parents’ names, roll numbers and subjects are out, the schools they taught in remain hidden. The op-ed tracks nine years of rot in Bengal’s teacher recruitment scam, from SLST to Supreme Court.

title: Miracle rescue: Survivor pulled from gutted Hong Kong building after 24 hrs; toll rises to 65
content: A man was rescued alive after being trapped for over 24 hours in a Hong Kong residential blaze that has claimed at least 65 lives. Emergency crews continue to battle the intense fire, facing structural dangers and extreme heat as they search for dozens still missing.

title: ChatGPT 'hacked': OpenAI user information at privacy risk; company issues warning
content: OpenAI users, beware! A security lapse at analytics provider Mixpanel exposed limited API user data, including names and emails. While no sensitive information like passwords or payment details were compromised, OpenAI has cut ties with Mixpanel and is notifying affected parties. Users are urged to watch for phishing attempts and bolster account security.

title: Cong's Bengal dilemma: Who should grand-old-party target in 2026 polls - BJP or Mamata?
content: Prime Minister Modi's declaration of Bengal as the BJP's next battlefield follows a thumping victory in Bihar. Meanwhile, the Congress faces an existential crisis in Bengal, squeezed between Mamata Banerjee's TMC and the rising BJP, with its own relevance rapidly diminishing.

title: WPL auction: Full list of sold and unsold players, base price, top buys, and team details
content: The WPL mega auction kicked off with a bang as UP Warriorz secured Deepti Sharma for Rs 3.2 crore, the day's highest bid. Mumbai Indians nabbed Amelia Kerr for Rs 3 crore. Notably, Australian captain Alyssa Healy went unsold, surprising many as the auction unfolded for the 2026 WPL season.

title: 'Only one will win': Mark Cuban warns AI giants— 'overspending bubble could pop'
content: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Don’t compromise on Vitamin D: Expert shares smart ways to use winter sunlight
content: Winter's low sunlight hinders vital vitamin D production, impacting immunity and bone health. Experts advise smart sun exposure, prioritizing midday for brief periods, and considering skin tone. Since sunlight alone is often insufficient, incorporating vitamin D-rich foods and supplements, guided by medical advice, is crucial for maintaining optimal levels throughout the colder months.

title: 'Tried to incite civil war': BJP attacks Rahul, makes big claim on 'X' accounts; Cong reacts
content: The BJP has accused the Congress of using social media accounts based outside India to shape domestic political narratives. Citing X's location-tracking features, BJP MP Sambit Patra alleged that several Congress-linked handles, including those of leaders and influencers, appear to be operating from countries like the US, Ireland, and Pakistan, pushing specific narratives against the government.

title: 'Next step UCC': CM Sarma after Assam bans polygamy; who is exempted?
content: The Assam Assembly has passed the Prohibition of Polygamy Bill, 2025, banning polygamous marriages across most of the state and imposing penalties for violations. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated the law is not against Islam and aims to promote true Islamic practices. The bill excludes Sixth Schedule areas and Scheduled Tribes.

title: Keep cucumber skin for more vitamins and minerals
content: Cucumber skin is a nutritional powerhouse packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. It supports digestion, bone strength, and skin health. Modern varieties are less bitter, making the skin palatable. Washing thoroughly ensures safety. Enjoying cucumbers with their skin on enhances meals with added fibre and essential nutrients. This simple change boosts overall wellness.

title: Meet Asha Sobhana, the first crorepati from Kerala at WPL auction
content: The action began innocuously, after the Delhi Capitals kicked things off at the base price of Rs 30 lakh. But the tempo surged swiftly as Delhi and UP Warriorz traded bids up to Rs 55 lakh.

title: Noah Gray injury update: Will Chiefs miss TE for Thanksgiving week 13?
content: Chiefs tight end Noah Gray has been ruled out for Week 13 after missing all practices with a concussion. Kansas City now turns to Robert Tonyan and Jared Wiley behind Travis Kelce as the team faces Dallas on Thanksgiving. Here’s what Gray’s absence means for the Chiefs’ rotation, their offensive plan, and Thursday’s high-pressure matchup.

title: Smriti Mandhana skips KBC shoot after wedding with Palaash Muchhal gets postponed
content: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17's silver jubilee celebration welcomed Indian women's cricket team players, but vice-captain Smriti Mandhana was absent. She missed the KBC shoot due to personal reasons following her wedding postponement after her father's hospitalization. Other team members and the head coach attended the special episode.

title: WPL Auction 2026: Who got whom - base price, final bid and team details
content: The Women's Premier League auction kicked off with a bang as Deepti Sharma fetched a massive Rs 3.2 crore, with UP Warriorz securing her via RTM. Sophie Devine also commanded a Rs 2 crore bid from Gujarat Giants. The fourth WPL season starts January 9, with matches in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara, advanced to accommodate the T20 World Cup.

title: CIA link, Afghan evacuee: Details emerge of White House shooter; what triggered attack?
content: An Afghan man who worked with US forces in Afghanistan is accused of a violent attack in Washington. He had been resettled in the US after the war. This incident has led to a halt in Afghan asylum and refugee processing. The move impacts thousands of families. It also raises concerns among Afghan communities and US veterans who supported them.

title: Another setback for Hasina: Ex-PM gets 21 yrs in jail; children face sentencing
content: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 21-year prison sentence in three corruption cases concerning land allocations. This verdict follows a separate death sentence for her role in last year's protests. Her son and daughter also received prison terms. Hasina, in exile in New Delhi, denies the charges, calling them politically motivated.

title: WPL expansion on the cards? DC co-owner says 'BCCI is planning'; pushes for home-away format
content: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal anticipates the addition of one or two new teams to the Women's Premier League (WPL) soon. He believes this expansion will enable the BCCI to transition the WPL to a home-and-away format, enhancing fan engagement and the league's growth. Jindal also highlighted the potential for increased popularity following India's recent Women's ODI World Cup victory.

title: Blake Lively Avoids Taylor Swift ‘Smear Campaign’ as Travis Kelce Stays Silent
content: Hollywood's once-tight Blake Lively-Taylor Swift friendship appears strained, with Lively's recent social media silence fueling speculation. This distance is reportedly linked to Lively's legal battle with co-star Justin Baldoni, which inadvertently involved Swift. Insiders suggest Swift is working to rebuild trust, indicating a complex, human dynamic behind the public perception of a feud.

title: CTET February 2026 registration begins at ctet.nic.in: Check details here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has opened the registration window for the CTET February 2026 cycle, with applications accepted online until 18 December 2025. Candidates must complete form submission and fee payment before the deadline. The exam will be held on 8 February 2026, with Paper-II in the morning and Paper-I in the evening.

title: 'Third-world parenting': Nalin Haley calls Ramaswamy 'creep'; who is desi MAGA backer?
content: Nalin Haley, son of Nikki Haley, has publicly criticized Vivek Ramaswamy's childcare proposals, calling them "third world parenting style." Haley, who advocates for strict immigration policies and has faced scrutiny over his own loyalty, is increasingly vocal on the right. This online spat highlights a growing divide within conservative politics.

title: Dharmendra prayer meet: Bobby Deol looks emotional; Rekha, Sidharth Malhotra & others pay respect
content: Bollywood's beloved Dharmendra was honored with a 'Celebration of Life' on November 27th, following his passing on November 24th, 2025. Family, including Bobby and Sunny Deol, alongside industry stars like Sidharth Malhotra and Jackie Shroff, gathered at Taj Lands End. Sonu Nigam performed iconic songs, reflecting Dharmendra's joyful spirit. Hema Malini shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his enduring legacy.

title: 11 killed in China: Train runs over rly workers; what went wrong?
content: Tragedy struck in China's Yunnan province as a test train collided with railway workers, claiming 11 lives and injuring two. The devastating incident occurred during a seismic-detection equipment test at Luoyang Town railway station. Authorities have launched an inquiry into the cause of this severe rail accident, the region's worst in over a decade.

title: Vascular surgeon shares one simple exercise for people with peripheral artery disease
content: A vascular surgeon successfully treated a young patient at risk of leg amputation due to PAD with a structured intermittent walking program. This exercise regimen, involving brisk walking intervals followed by rest, promoted collateral artery growth, significantly reducing pain and restoring mobility, ultimately avoiding amputation.

title: “It wasn’t easy”: Gisele Bündchen opens up about shock over Brady’s past
content: Supermodel Gisele Bundchen revealed the shock of discovering Tom Brady's ex was pregnant just two months into their relationship. Despite this, they married and she embraced his son, Jack. After over a decade of marriage, the couple announced their separation in October 2022, with Bundchen now a mother again and Brady reportedly single.

title: Terror plot foiled: Police nab 19-yr-old Jammu teen; cops suspect Pak link
content: Jammu Police apprehended a 19-year-old for plotting a terror attack, with suspected links to Pakistan-based handlers.  Simultaneously, Kashmir Valley saw extensive raids targeting the banned Jamaat-e-Islami, aiming to dismantle terror networks.  Authorities seized electronic devices and documents during these operations.

title: Worried about your lungs amidst rising pollution? 3 ways to test them at home
content: The breath-holding test provides a fast method to evaluate your lung capacity together, with breathing control abilities. Take a deep breath before you attempt to hold your breath, for as long as you can. People with healthy lungs usually manage to hold their breath between 30 to 50 seconds. Your doctor needs to evaluate your lung capacity when you cannot hold your breath for more than 20 seconds

title: 'Social burden, not penal': SC tells Samay Raina, 3 comics to platform disabled achievers
content: The Supreme Court has directed comedian Samay Raina and three others to host shows featuring specially-abled individuals with inspiring stories. These events aim to raise funds for the treatment of persons with disabilities, with the CJI emphasizing this as a social responsibility for well-placed individuals. The directive comes amid a plea against comedians for insensitive remarks about people with disabilities.

title: Stuart Skinner struggles as Oilers teammates reportedly push for trade
content: Edmonton Oilers goaltender Stuart Skinner had a rough outing against the Dallas Stars, with defensive lapses and late line changes leaving him vulnerable. Fans of the NHL criticized the team’s effort. While captain Connor McDavid highlighted that goaltending is a team responsibility. The loss raises questions about Edmonton’s defense and Skinner’s role moving forward.

title: Tua Tagovailoa sings 'Thinking out loud,' brings Thanksgiving cheer at Florida hospital
content: Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa and his wife Annah visited Joe DiMaggio Children’s Hospital, bringing Thanksgiving cheer to young patients. The couple engaged in games, packed caregiver kits, signed autographs, and even performed a song, demonstrating their commitment to the Tua Foundation's mission of spreading joy and support to families during difficult times.

title: '27th floor, room 1 — he is dead': Eyewitnesses recall Hong Kong fire; what sparked the tragedy?
content: A devastating fire ripped through Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court complex, claiming over 50 lives and leaving hundreds injured or missing. Residents described harrowing escapes as flames engulfed their homes. Suspected to be fueled by combustible bamboo scaffolding used for repairs, the blaze spread rapidly, prompting a massive rescue effort and leaving many homeless.

title: WPL auction: Australian star Alyssa Healy goes unsold
content: The 2026 Women's Premier League mega-auction commenced with a surprising unsold bid for Australian captain Alyssa Healy, who was hampered by recent calf and past finger injuries.  The auction features a wide age range of players, with franchises aiming to fill 73 slots, including 23 for overseas talent.

title: What happens to the human body before freezing to death explained
content: Extreme cold triggers a silent shutdown of the body. Initially, shivering and numbness give way to confusion and weakness as core temperature drops. The body's systems, including the brain and heart, progressively fail. This leads to a deceptive sense of peace before death, underscoring the critical need to recognize early hypothermia signs and act swiftly to prevent fatal outcomes.

title: Map dispute: Nepal's new Rs 100 notes features Indian territories; revives 2020 row
content: Nepal's central bank has released new Rs 100 notes featuring a revised national map that includes disputed territories claimed by India. This move reignites a long-standing border dispute, with India previously condemning Nepal's 2020 map update as an unacceptable "artificial enlargement" of claims.

title: 'My lungs have adapted, it's fine': Vir Das quips on Mumbai's deteriorating air
content: Mumbai's air quality has significantly deteriorated, with several areas entering the 'very poor' category. Actor Vir Das highlighted the issue in a viral video, comparing the internal air quality to the smoggy exterior. Local activities, traffic, and wind patterns are cited as reasons for the varying pollution levels across the city.

title: 'Sorry': Rishabh Pant posts emotional message after 0-2 drubbing against South Africa
content: India's Test team suffered a significant defeat, losing 0-2 to South Africa in their home series. Vice-captain Rishabh Pant, leading in Shubman Gill's absence, apologized to fans for the team's performance. This series marked South Africa's first Test series victory in India in 25 years, extending India's poor home record.

title: White House shooting: US suspends immigration requests of Afghans
content: Two National Guard soldiers were critically wounded in a daylight shooting near the White House by an Afghan national with US military ties. The suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, was apprehended after a firefight. President Trump labeled the incident an "act of terror," leading to a halt in Afghan refugee processing and sparking debate on immigration policies.

title: Take history to the people to counter Sangh Parivar narrative, says Kerala CM
content: Heinous attempts are being made in Kerala to spread divisive mentality and bring back regressive practices which had been eradicated, Pinarayi says at the international annual session of Kerala History Congress

title: TTD Executive Engineer 'arrested' in laddu adulteration case
content: Total number of arrests goes up to 10 in the case related to alleged use of spurious ghee in making Tirumala laddus during 2019-24

title: Gujarat government begins three-day ‘Chintan Shibir’ in Valsad
content: According to an official release, the sessions will focus on adopting a governance model that is more sensitive, technology-driven and transparent

title: Sachin Pilot accuses BJP of misleading voters over illegal immigrants
content: Congress leader questions Special Intensive Revision and Election Commission role in electoral roll exercise

title: Eight years on, Hyderabad Metro Rail faces growing pains
content: The three-corridor network that once promised seamless connectivity now struggles with overcrowded trains, neglected infrastructure, and no immediate relief in sight

title: AIADMK, TVK suggest changes to draft SOP for political meetings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan ask them to submit their suggestions in writing on Friday

title: Four-year-old boy murdered in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The boy was reportedly kidnapped from his anganwadi on Wednesday evening by a close relative and allegedly killed, say police

title: Leadership change: High Command hopeful of resolution in meeting on Saturday
content: Mallikarjun Kharge says Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar will be called for Delhi to settle the matter on power sharing

title: M.P. govt.’s show-cause notice to IAS officer over controversial remarks; brahmin bodies seek FIR
content: State government says remarks made by Verma prima facie amounted to “harming social harmony and creating animosity in the society” and fell under the category of “indiscipline and serious misconduct”

title: Udayagiri MLA assures support to kin of deceased TDP leader
content: Kakarla Suresh consoles family members of TDP leader Gottipati Prasad Naidu, who was murdered in daylight at Chintalapalem village in SPSR Nellore district

title: KSEB to take up repair of generator in Moolamattom  plant
content: Earlier, KSEB aimed to fix leakage in the main intake valves of generators five and six. During inspection, inlet valve leakage was found in generator four

title: Stir intensifies as contract workers lock main gate at NMDC plants
content: More than 500 workers participate in the blockade demanding that all recently terminated contract workers be reinstated immediately

title: A.P. Tourism ties up with Rapido to offer ‘Driver-cum-Guide’ services to tourists
content: Rapido drivers with high ratings will be trained by the Tourism Department on the State’s history, culture, hospitality and safety.

title: After complaints from MPs, CISF alters tenure and posting policy at Parliament
content: Tenure to be extended to four years from three to increase familiarity with MPs, says officials; personnel with clean service record and who psychological examination to be posted

title: Congress rebel redraws battle lines in Chullikkal
content: The division was once a UDF stronghold until the LDF wrested it in 2015; this year’s contest features a sitting councillor contesting as an Independent, past players returning to the fray, and a larger electorate after delimitation

title: Kerala HC reserves its order on plea by Catholic Congress against scenes in Malayalam film Haal
content: Order reserved on the appeal filed by the Catholic Congress against a single judge’s order to the CBFC to grant A-certification for the film

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: When an LDF Independent flaunts a Maudany connection
content: The posters of Nishad Nadakkal, an LDF Independent in an Erattupetta ward, display the image of PDP founder Abdul Nasir Maudany. LDF leaders say Nishad has resigned from PDP, while PDP leaders insist that he is a loyalist for three decades

title: Calicut University V-C selection faces delay over search panel’s status
content: The Kerala High Court has ordered the senate to select its nominee within 30 days.  Selection process for the V-C’s post can only commence when the search-cum-selection committee is in place.

title: Srisailam temple management to enforce plastic ban
content: Temple executive officer asks local businesspersons to use clay, steel or brass bottles for water instead of plastic bottles

title: Name won’t feature in draft electoral rolls if enumeration form is not submitted by December 4, says Chief Electoral Officer
content: The forms in which only the first part has been filled in will be taken into account says Archana Patnaik

title: TDB probes ‘lapse’ after honey supplied in acid containers
content: The stock, which passed inspection by the Food Safety Laboratory at Pampa, is primarily used for performing the Ashtabhishekam ritual and is not for devotees’ consumption, say officials.

title: Woman meets Kerala CM, files complaint of sexual exploitation and coerced pregnancy termination against MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Pinarayi Vijayan forwards complaint to State Police Chief Ravada Chandrasekhar for further action.  Police may seek court’s sanction to record complainant’s statement in-camera before a Magistrate under Section 183 of BNSS

title: Withdraw new labour codes, demands Congress
content: Party leader Udit Raj says the four labour codes strip workers of their rights, eliminate job security, and only serve the interests of corporations

title: Madanayakanahalli and Rajanakunte police stations added to city commissionerate
content: The proposal submitted before the govt. highlights a surge in criminal cases and traffic congestion in these areas, necessitating closer policing under the city unit

title: GBA orders institutions to report stray dog presence, submit action plan as per SC directive
content: A nodal officer should be appointed by institutions, and the officer will be responsbile for waste management, maintaining cleanliness, preventing dog re-entry, and coordinating with the municipal corporation

title: Assam Assembly passes Bill to ban polygamy
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said a Bill on Uniform Civil Code will be tabled if he retains the post after the 2026 Assembly polls

title: Man arrested for stealing valuables worth ₹48.50 lakh from train
content: Railway police officials nab the accused at a jewellery shop in Vijayawada while he was trying to sell the stolen gold ornaments

title: How long will police conduct inquiry into death of celebrity manager Disha Salian, asks Bombay HC
content: Disha Salian, former manager of actor Sushant Singh Rajput, died in June 8, 2020 after falling off a residential building in Malad, Mumbai

title: JCTU stages protest opposing new labour codes
content: The demonstration follows a nation-wide call given by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and the Joint Committee of Trade Unions

title: Scientist calls for preparedness to face biosecurity threats
content: Prasanna has also called upon the international community of scientists engaged in studying pests to work on risk management, data management, and guiding preparedness for invasive pests like fall armyworm

title: State to seek withdrawal of Labour Codes: Sivankutty
content: Labour Minister V. Sivankutty says he, along with trade union representatives, will meet the Union Labour Minister

title: ‘Pourakarmikas should be allowed to use toilets in all hotels in GBA limits’
content: ‘Officials have been instructed to initiate measures to set up restrooms in all locations where such facilities are absent’

title: New guidelines for gig platforms make verification, GPS tracking, and in-app SOS feature mandatory
content: Gig platforms must conduct thorough police verification and background checks of every delivery partner and driver before they start the work, says Police Commissioner Seemant Kumar Singh

title: 14-persons cyber fraud gang, including 6 based in Cambodia arrested by Bhimavaram police
content: The modus operandi of the gang was to collect mule bank accounts for transferring money into these accounts from the victims of ‘digital arrests’; Three accused based in Cambodia are from Visakhapatnam

title: India, Indonesia make forward push on BrahMos deal at Defence Ministers’ Dialogue
content: The Ministers expressed satisfaction with the outcomes and committed to sustained high-level engagement to promote peace, stability and prosperity across the Indo-Pacific region

title: Netflix opposes in Delhi High Court Wankhede's plea against web series
content: IRS officer Sameer Wankhede has sought that the series, which he has alleged to be defamatory, is taken down from several websites

title: At least 65 dead as Hong Kong firefighters battle burning towers for second day
content: Rescues were continuing in some of the towers, but authorities did not provide updates on the missing or how many were still trapped inside the ravaged buildings

title: KFRI signs MoU with Odisha Bamboo Development Agency
content: The MoU marks the beginning of a long-term partnership built on scientific collaboration, knowledge sharing, and a shared vision for transforming the bamboo sector.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Coimbatore gang-rape: police get one-day custody of the three accused
content: The judge directs the police to produce the accused before the court by 4 p.m. on Friday, November 28, after interrogating them in custody

title: K-RIDE set to get full-time Managing Director after nearly three years
content: According to sources, Lakshman Singh, a 1996-batch officer from the Indian Railway Service of Engineers, is expected to be appointed as the full-time MD anytime soon.

title: Ensure quality in road construction or face action: Gadkari to contractors
content: ₹20,000 crore will be allocated for National Highways and other related projects in Gujarat by Central Government, assures Nitin Gadkari

title: Hosur airport: Tamil Nadu government on the lookout for consultant to prepare Detailed Techno-Economic Report
content: Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation (TIDCO) has now issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) to finalise a consultant.

title: Buzz: Struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, fantasy football
content: insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been calling sources around the league for the latest news and buzz on key situations . this week, they have the newest intel on the slumping Buccaneers . we also pick out the most important players in the NFL for the stretch run .

title: Three bets on overreactions and mismatches of college football's Rivalry Week
content: this is a card of overreaction and straight mismatches . "Georgia is better than Pitt" is just lazy box score fluff with no premise . the Bulldogs are 121st in pressure with only 16 sacks, one of the most important indicators .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks
content: Matt Bowen breaks down his fantasy expectations for Rashee Rice in week 13 . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

title: MLB offseason grades: AL champs land an ace as Blue Jays sign Cease
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: Thanksgiving throwbacks from Lions, Cowboys top NFL Week 13 looks
content: the Baltimore Ravens will wear their classic threads on the holiday against the green Bay Packers . the combination includes a silver helmet, navy jersey and white pant look . it's a busy week for alternates as part of the league's John Madden Thanksgiving celebration .

title: Women: Texas, South Carolina to meet for Players Era title
content: four of the nation's best -- Duke , South Carolina , Texas and UCLA -- will compete in a final four-caliber event . the event is the highlight of the holiday week tournaments and games . many of these games will have far better stretches on the women's basketball calendar .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: 🏈 CFB Bottom 10: The 'Lane Train' hits the buffers
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: One genre, many audiences: A quarter century of sports movies, ranked
content: a seton hall sports poll surveyed 1,519 adults in the past quarter century . one title stood out as the defining sports movie of this century, according to a poll . "the blind side" was the sports movie Americans reached for most, edging out another .

title: Previewing the Thanksgiving three-pack: Picks, predictions, fantasy X factors
content: the average over/under point total of 51.2 is the highest for Thanksgiving games over the past 40 seasons . ESPN Research provides optimistic stats for all six teams, along with betting nuggets to know . three analysts give us final score picks for the three games .
